name: 2. Dataset Definition and Preparation
content:
Data Description

The project uses four primary datasets:

1.Customer Data

  • Attributes: Distributor ID, Customer ID, Name, Start Date, Country ID
  • Type: Mostly categorical (IDs, names, country) + temporal (start date).
  • Granularity: Customer-level information.

2.Sales Data

  • Attributes: Distributor ID, Customer ID, Invoice Date, Invoice No, SKU ID, Quantity, Gross, Unit Price, Discounts, Net Sales.
  • Type: Combination of categorical (IDs), numerical (quantity, prices, discounts), temporal (invoice date).
  • Granularity: Transaction-level records.

3.Product Data

  • Attributes: Sector, Category, Subcategory, SKU ID.
  • Type: Categorical.
  • Granularity: Product-level hierarchy mapping.

4.Distribution Data

  • Attributes: Distributor ID, Distributor Name, Country ID.
  • Type: Categorical.
  • Granularity: Distributor-level metadata.

Time Coverage: Sales dataset covers transactions dated 2021â€“2023.

Data Preparation

Key preparation steps include:

  • Handle missing customer start dates or distributor mapping.
  • Remove duplicate invoice records.
  • Standardize country codes.
  • Compute Customer Lifetime Value (CLV) from cumulative net sales.
  • Calculate purchase frequency (invoices per month).
  • Derive average order size and discount utilization rate.
  • Map products to categories and sectors for aggregated preferences.
  • Normalize numerical variables (e.g., sales, discounts) for clustering.
  • Encode categorical variables (country, sector).
  • Create aggregated customer-level dataset from transaction-level data.
